title: (Pwn2Own) Canon imageCLASS MF644Cdw privet Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Canon imageCLASS MF644Cdw printers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the privet API. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: Canon has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.usa.canon.com/internet/portal/us/home/support/product-advisories/detail/canon-laser-printer-and-small-office-multifunctional-printer-measure-against-buffer-overflow/
timeline:
2022-01-21 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-03-18 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2023-03-08 - Advisory Updated
credit: Nicolas Devillers ( @nikaiw ), Jean-Romain Garnier and Raphael Rigo ( @_trou_ )
